DisplayObject.name: DisplayObject
DisplayObject.description:
The base class for all objects that are rendered on the screen.
This is an abstract class and should not be used on its own rather it should be extended.

DisplayObjectContainer.name: DisplayObjectContainer
DisplayObjectContainer.description:
A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects.
It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description: The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen

params.name: texture

SpriteBatch.name: SpriteBatch

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: A Stage represents the root of the display tree. Everything connected to the stage is rendered

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
the background color of the stage, you have to pass this in is in hex format
     like: 0xFFFFFF for white

Creating a stage is a mandatory process when you use Pixi, which is as simple as this : 
var stage = new PIXI.Stage(0xFFFFFF);
where the parameter given is the background colour of the stage, in hex
you will use this stage instance to add your sprites to it and therefore to the renderer
Here is how to add a sprite to the stage : 
stage.addChild(sprite);

params.name: texture
params.description: - The texture to use on the rope.

params.name: points
params.description: - An array of {PIXI.Point}.

params.name: texture
params.description: The texture to use

params.name: width
params.description: the width

params.name: height
params.description: the height

TilingSprite.name: TilingSprite
TilingSprite.description: A tiling sprite is a fast way of rendering a tiling image

params.name: texture
params.description: the texture of the tiling sprite

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the tiling sprite

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the tiling sprite

AbstractFilter.name: AbstractFilter
AbstractFilter.description:
This is the base class for creating a PIXI filter. Currently only webGL supports filters.
If you want to make a custom filter this should be your base class.

params.name: fragmentSrc
params.description: The fragment source in an array of strings.

params.name: uniforms
params.description: An object containing the uniforms for this filter.

Graphics.name: Graphics
Graphics.description: The Graphics class contains methods used to draw primitive shapes such as lines, circles and rectangles to the display, and color and fill them.

params.name: lineWidth
params.description: the width of the line to draw

params.name: lineColor
params.description: the color of the line to draw

params.name: lineAlpha
params.description: the alpha of the line to draw

params.name: fillColor
params.description: the color of the fill

params.name: fillAlpha
params.description: the alpha of the fill

params.name: fill
params.description: whether or not the shape is filled with a colour

params.name: shape
params.description: The shape object to draw.

CanvasBuffer.name: CanvasBuffer
CanvasBuffer.description: Creates a Canvas element of the given size.

params.name: width
params.description: the width for the newly created canvas

params.name: height
params.description: the height for the newly created canvas

CanvasMaskManager.name: CanvasMaskManager
CanvasMaskManager.description: A set of functions used to handle masking.

CanvasGraphics.name: CanvasGraphics
CanvasGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the canvas renderer to draw the primitive graphics data.

CanvasRenderer.name: CanvasRenderer
CanvasRenderer.description:
The CanvasRenderer draws the Stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.
Don't forget to add the CanvasRenderer.view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: options
params.description: The optional renderer parameters

props.name: view
props.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

props.name: transparent
props.description: If the render view is transparent, default false

props.name: autoResize
props.description: If the render view is automatically resized, default false

props.name: resolution
props.description: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

props.name: clearBeforeRender
props.description: This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

params.name: width
params.description: the horizontal range of the filter

params.name: height
params.description: the vertical range of the filter

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

params.name: gl
params.description: the current WebGL drawing context

WebGLGraphics.name: WebGLGraphics
WebGLGraphics.description: A set of functions used by the webGL renderer to draw the primitive graphics data

WebGLRenderer.name: WebGLRenderer
WebGLRenderer.description:
The WebGLRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer
should be used for browsers that support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs.
So no need for Sprite Batches or Sprite Clouds.
Don't forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: options
params.description: The optional renderer parameters

props.name: view
props.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

props.name: transparent
props.description: If the render view is transparent, default false

props.name: autoResize
props.description: If the render view is automatically resized, default false

props.name: antialias
props.description: sets antialias (only applicable in chrome at the moment)

props.name: preserveDrawingBuffer
props.description: enables drawing buffer preservation, enable this if you need to call toDataUrl on the webgl context

props.name: resolution
props.description: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

BaseTexture.name: BaseTexture
BaseTexture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image. All textures have a base texture.

params.name: source
params.description: the source object (image or canvas)

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

RenderTexture.name: RenderTexture

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the render texture

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the render texture

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer used for this RenderTexture

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

params.name: resolution
params.description: The resolution of the texture being generated

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
A texture stores the information that represents an image or part of an image. It cannot be added
to the display list directly. Instead use it as the texture for a PIXI.Sprite. If no frame is provided then the whole image is used.

params.name: baseTexture
params.description: The base texture source to create the texture from

params.name: frame
params.description: The rectangle frame of the texture to show

params.name: crop
params.description: The area of original texture

params.name: trim
params.description: Trimmed texture rectangle

CanvasPool.name: CanvasPool
CanvasPool.description: The CanvasPool is a global static object that allows Pixi and Phaser to pool canvas DOM elements.

EventTarget.name: EventTarget
EventTarget.description: Mixins event emitter functionality to a class

Event.name: Event
Event.description: Creates an homogenous object for tracking events so users can know what to expect.

params.name: target
params.description: The target object that the event is called on

params.name: name
params.description: The string name of the event that was triggered

params.name: data
params.description: Arbitrary event data to pass along

PolyK.name: PolyK

PIXI.name: PIXI
PIXI.description:
Namespace-class for [pixi.js](http://www.pixijs.com/).

Contains assorted static properties and enumerations.

classitems.description: The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description: The scale factor of the object.
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description:
The transform callback is an optional callback that if set will be called at the end of the updateTransform method and sent two parameters:
This Display Objects worldTransform matrix and its parents transform matrix. Both are PIXI.Matrix object types.
The matrix are passed by reference and can be modified directly without needing to return them.
This ability allows you to check any of the matrix values and perform actions such as clamping scale or limiting rotation, regardless of the parent transforms.
classitems.name: transformCallback

classitems.description: The context under which the transformCallback is invoked.
classitems.name: transformCallbackContext

classitems.description: The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around
classitems.name: pivot

classitems.description: The rotation of the object in radians.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description: The opacity of the object.
classitems.name: alpha

classitems.description: The visibility of the object.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description:
This is the defined area that will pick up mouse / touch events. It is null by default.
Setting it is a neat way of optimising the hitTest function that the interactionManager will use (as it will not need to hit test all the children)
classitems.name: hitArea

classitems.description: Can this object be rendered
classitems.name: renderable

classitems.description: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.
classitems.name: stage

classitems.description: [read-only] The multiplied alpha of the displayObject
classitems.name: worldAlpha

classitems.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors
classitems.name: worldTransform

classitems.description:
The position of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.
classitems.name: worldPosition

classitems.description:
The scale of the Display Object based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.
classitems.name: worldScale

classitems.description:
The rotation of the Display Object, in radians, based on the world transform.
This value is updated at the end of updateTransform and takes all parent transforms into account.
classitems.name: worldRotation

classitems.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation
classitems.name: _sr

classitems.description: cached sin rotation and cos rotation
classitems.name: _cr

classitems.description:
The area the filter is applied to like the hitArea this is used as more of an optimisation
rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle
classitems.name: filterArea

classitems.description: The original, cached bounds of the object
classitems.name: _bounds

classitems.description: The most up-to-date bounds of the object
classitems.name: _currentBounds

classitems.description: The original, cached mask of the object
classitems.name: _mask

classitems.description: Cached internal flag.
classitems.name: _cacheAsBitmap

classitems.description: Cached internal flag.
classitems.name: _cacheIsDirty

classitems.description:
Destroy this DisplayObject.
Removes all references to transformCallbacks, its parent, the stage, filters, bounds, mask and cached Sprites.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: [read-only] Indicates if the sprite is globally visible.
classitems.name: worldVisible

classitems.description:
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it.
In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping.
To remove a mask, set this property to null.
classitems.name: mask

classitems.description:
Sets the filters for the displayObject.
IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the Canvas renderer.

To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'.

You cannot have a filter and a multiply blend mode active at the same time. Setting a filter will reset
this objects blend mode to NORMAL.
classitems.name: filters

classitems.description:
Set if this display object is cached as a bitmap.
This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects.
To remove simply set this property to 'null'
classitems.name: cacheAsBitmap

classitems.description: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObject as a rectangle object
classitems.name: getBounds

classitems.description: Retrieves the local bounds of the displayObject as a rectangle object
classitems.name: getLocalBounds

classitems.description: Sets the object's stage reference, the stage this object is connected to
classitems.name: setStageReference

params.name: stage
params.description: the stage that the object will have as its current stage reference

classitems.description: Empty, to be overridden by classes that require it.
classitems.name: preUpdate

classitems.description:
Useful function that returns a texture of the displayObject object that can then be used to create sprites
This can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.
classitems.name: generateTexture

params.name: resolution
params.description: The resolution of the texture being generated

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

params.name: renderer
params.description: The renderer used to generate the texture.

return.description: a texture of the graphics object

classitems.description: Generates and updates the cached sprite for this object.
classitems.name: updateCache

classitems.description: Calculates the global position of the display object
classitems.name: toGlobal

params.name: position
params.description: The world origin to calculate from

return.description: A point object representing the position of this object

classitems.description: Calculates the local position of the display object relative to another point
classitems.name: toLocal

params.name: position
params.description: The world origin to calculate from

params.name: from
params.description: The DisplayObject to calculate the global position from

return.description: A point object representing the position of this object

classitems.description: Internal method.
classitems.name: _renderCachedSprite

params.name: renderSession
params.description: The render session

classitems.description: Internal method.
classitems.name: _generateCachedSprite

classitems.description: Destroys the cached sprite.
classitems.name: _destroyCachedSprite

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer
classitems.name: _renderWebGL

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer
classitems.name: _renderCanvas

classitems.description: The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
classitems.name: x

classitems.description: The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
classitems.name: y

classitems.description: [read-only] The array of children of this container.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: The width of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the displayObjectContainer, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container.
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject to add to the container

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown
classitems.name: addChildAt

params.name: child
params.description: The child to add

params.name: index
params.description: The index to place the child in

classitems.description: Swaps the position of 2 Display Objects within this container.
classitems.name: swapChildren

classitems.description: Returns the index position of a child DisplayObject instance
classitems.name: getChildIndex

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject instance to identify

return.description: The index position of the child display object to identify

classitems.description: Changes the position of an existing child in the display object container
classitems.name: setChildIndex

params.name: child
params.description: The child DisplayObject instance for which you want to change the index number

params.name: index
params.description: The resulting index number for the child display object

classitems.description: Returns the child at the specified index
classitems.name: getChildAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index to get the child from

return.description: The child at the given index, if any.

classitems.description: Removes a child from the container.
classitems.name: removeChild

params.name: child
params.description: The DisplayObject to remove

classitems.description: Removes a child from the specified index position.
classitems.name: removeChildAt

params.name: index
params.description: The index to get the child from

classitems.description: Removes all children from this container that are within the begin and end indexes.
classitems.name: removeChildren

params.name: beginIndex
params.description: The beginning position. Default value is 0.

params.name: endIndex
params.description: The ending position. Default value is size of the container.

classitems.description: Retrieves the bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes all visible children into consideration.
classitems.name: getBounds

classitems.description: Retrieves the non-global local bounds of the displayObjectContainer as a rectangle. The calculation takes all visible children into consideration.
classitems.name: getLocalBounds

classitems.description: Sets the containers Stage reference. This is the Stage that this object, and all of its children, is connected to.
classitems.name: setStageReference

params.name: stage
params.description: the stage that the container will have as its current stage reference

classitems.description: Removes the current stage reference from the container and all of its children.
classitems.name: removeStageReference

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer
classitems.name: _renderWebGL

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer
classitems.name: _renderCanvas

classitems.description:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner
classitems.name: anchor

classitems.description: The texture that the sprite is using
classitems.name: texture

classitems.description: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: _width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: _height

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.
classitems.name: tint

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.
classitems.name: cachedTint

classitems.description: A canvas that contains the tinted version of the Sprite (in Canvas mode, WebGL doesn't populate this)
classitems.name: tintedTexture

classitems.description:
The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

Warning: You cannot have a blend mode and a filter active on the same Sprite. Doing so will render the sprite invisible.
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: The shader that will be used to render the texture to the stage. Set to null to remove a current shader.
classitems.name: shader

classitems.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
Sets the texture of the sprite. Be warned that this doesn't remove or destroy the previous
texture this Sprite was using.
classitems.name: setTexture

params.name: texture
params.description: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

params.name: destroy
params.description: Call Texture.destroy on the current texture before replacing it with the new one?

classitems.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame
classitems.name: onTextureUpdate

classitems.description: Returns the bounds of the Sprite as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes the worldTransform into account.
classitems.name: getBounds

params.name: matrix
params.description: the transformation matrix of the sprite

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer
classitems.name: _renderWebGL

params.name: matrix
params.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer
classitems.name: _renderCanvas

params.name: matrix
params.description: - Optional matrix. If provided the Display Object will be rendered using this matrix, otherwise it will use its worldTransform.

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture from the TextureCache based on the frameId
 The frame ids are created when a Texture packer file has been loaded
classitems.name: fromFrame

params.name: frameId
params.description: The frame Id of the texture in the cache

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the frameId

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture based on an image url
 If the image is not in the texture cache it will be loaded
classitems.name: fromImage

params.name: imageId
params.description: The image url of the texture

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the image id

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer
classitems.name: _renderCanvas

classitems.description: [read-only] Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors
classitems.name: worldTransform

classitems.description: Sets the background color for the stage
classitems.name: setBackgroundColor

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
the color of the background, easiest way to pass this in is in hex format
     like: 0xFFFFFF for white

classitems.description: The texture of the strip
classitems.name: texture

classitems.description: Whether the strip is dirty or not
classitems.name: dirty

classitems.description: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: Triangles in canvas mode are automatically antialiased, use this value to force triangles to overlap a bit with each other.
classitems.name: canvasPadding

classitems.description: Renders a flat strip
classitems.name: renderStripFlat

params.name: strip
params.description: The Strip to render

classitems.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame
classitems.name: onTextureUpdate

classitems.description: Returns the bounds of the mesh as a rectangle. The bounds calculation takes the worldTransform into account.
classitems.name: getBounds

params.name: matrix
params.description: the transformation matrix of the sprite

classitems.description: Different drawing buffer modes supported
The width of the tiling sprite
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the tiling sprite
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The scaling of the image that is being tiled
classitems.name: tileScale

classitems.description: A point that represents the scale of the texture object
classitems.name: tileScaleOffset

classitems.description: The offset position of the image that is being tiled
classitems.name: tilePosition

classitems.description: Whether this sprite is renderable or not
classitems.name: renderable

classitems.description: The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value

classitems.description:
If enabled a green rectangle will be drawn behind the generated tiling texture, allowing you to visually
debug the texture being used.
classitems.name: textureDebug

classitems.description: The blend mode to be applied to the sprite
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: The CanvasBuffer object that the tiled texture is drawn to.

classitems.description: An internal Texture object that holds the tiling texture that was generated from TilingSprite.texture.
classitems.name: tilingTexture

classitems.description: The Context fill pattern that is used to draw the TilingSprite in Canvas mode only (will be null in WebGL).
classitems.name: tilePattern

classitems.description:
If true the TilingSprite will run generateTexture on its **next** render pass.
This is set by the likes of Phaser.LoadTexture.setFrame.
classitems.name: refreshTexture

classitems.description: Renders the object using the WebGL renderer
classitems.name: _renderWebGL

classitems.description: Renders the object using the Canvas renderer

classitems.description: When the texture is updated, this event will fire to update the scale and frame

params.name: forcePowerOfTwo
params.description: Whether we want to force the texture to be a power of two

classitems.description: The width of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the TilingSprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
An array of passes - some filters contain a few steps this array simply stores the steps in a liniear fashion.
For example the blur filter has two passes blurX and blurY.
classitems.name: passes

classitems.description: Syncs the uniforms between the class object and the shaders.
classitems.name: syncUniforms

classitems.description: The alpha value used when filling the Graphics object.
classitems.name: fillAlpha

classitems.description: The width (thickness) of any lines drawn.
classitems.name: lineWidth

classitems.description: The color of any lines drawn.

classitems.description: Graphics data
classitems.name: graphicsData

classitems.description: The tint applied to the graphic shape. This is a hex value. Apply a value of 0xFFFFFF to reset the tint.
classitems.name: tint

classitems.description: The blend mode to be applied to the graphic shape. Apply a value of PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL to reset the blend mode.
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: Current path
classitems.name: currentPath

classitems.description: Array containing some WebGL-related properties used by the WebGL renderer.
classitems.name: _webGL

classitems.description: Whether this shape is being used as a mask.
classitems.name: isMask

classitems.description: The bounds' padding used for bounds calculation.
classitems.name: boundsPadding

classitems.description: Used to detect if the graphics object has changed. If this is set to true then the graphics object will be recalculated.
classitems.name: dirty

classitems.description: Used to detect if the webgl graphics object has changed. If this is set to true then the graphics object will be recalculated.
classitems.name: webGLDirty

classitems.description: Used to detect if the cached sprite object needs to be updated.
classitems.name: cachedSpriteDirty

classitems.description: Specifies the line style used for subsequent calls to Graphics methods such as the lineTo() method or the drawCircle() method.
classitems.name: lineStyle

params.name: lineWidth
params.description: width of the line to draw, will update the objects stored style

params.name: color
params.description: color of the line to draw, will update the objects stored style

params.name: alpha
params.description: alpha of the line to draw, will update the objects stored style

classitems.description: Moves the current drawing position to x, y.
classitems.name: moveTo

params.name: x
params.description: the X coordinate to move to

params.name: y
params.description: the Y coordinate to move to

classitems.description:
Draws a line using the current line style from the current drawing position to (x, y);
The current drawing position is then set to (x, y).
classitems.name: lineTo

params.name: x
params.description: the X coordinate to draw to

params.name: y
params.description: the Y coordinate to draw to

classitems.description:
Calculate the points for a quadratic bezier curve and then draws it.
Based on: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/785097/how-do-i-implement-a-bezier-curve-in-c
classitems.name: quadraticCurveTo

params.name: cpX
params.description: Control point x

params.name: cpY
params.description: Control point y

params.name: toX
params.description: Destination point x

params.name: toY
params.description: Destination point y

classitems.description: Calculate the points for a bezier curve and then draws it.
classitems.name: bezierCurveTo

params.name: cpX
params.description: Control point x

params.name: cpY
params.description: Control point y

params.name: cpX2
params.description: Second Control point x

classitems.description:
When cacheAsBitmap is set to true the graphics object will be rendered as if it was a sprite.
This is useful if your graphics element does not change often, as it will speed up the rendering of the object in exchange for taking up texture memory.
It is also useful if you need the graphics object to be anti-aliased, because it will be rendered using canvas.
This is not recommended if you are constantly redrawing the graphics element.
classitems.name: cacheAsBitmap

classitems.description:
This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color.
If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.
classitems.name: clearBeforeRender

Mat Groves

for creating the original pixi version!
Also a thanks to https://github.com/bchevalier for tweaking the tint and alpha so that they now share 4 bytes on the vertex buffer

classitems.description:
This sets if the WebGLRenderer will clear the context texture or not before the new render pass. If true:
If the Stage is NOT transparent, Pixi will clear to alpha (0, 0, 0, 0).
If the Stage is transparent, Pixi will clear to the target Stage's background color.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example: if your game has a canvas filling background image, you often don't need this set.

Forces this BaseTexture to be set as loaded, with the given width and height.

Important for when you don't want to modify the source object by forcing in `complete` or dimension properties it may not have.

classitems.description:
TextureSilentFail is a boolean that defaults to `false`. 
If `true` then `PIXI.Texture.setFrame` will no longer throw an error if the texture dimensions are incorrect. 
Instead `Texture.valid` will be set to `false` (#1556)
Does this Texture have any frame data assigned to it?

classitems.description: The texture trim data.
classitems.name: trim

classitems.description: This will let the renderer know if the texture is valid. If it's not then it cannot be rendered.
classitems.name: valid

classitems.description: Is this a tiling texture? As used by the likes of a TilingSprite.
classitems.name: isTiling

classitems.description: This will let a renderer know that a texture has been updated (used mainly for webGL uv updates)
classitems.name: requiresUpdate

classitems.description: This will let a renderer know that a tinted parent has updated its texture.
classitems.name: requiresReTint

classitems.description: The WebGL UV data cache.
classitems.name: _uvs

classitems.description: The width of the Texture in pixels.
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the Texture in pixels.
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
This is the area of the BaseTexture image to actually copy to the Canvas / WebGL when rendering,
irrespective of the actual frame size or placement (which can be influenced by trimmed texture atlases)
classitems.name: crop

classitems.description: Called when the base texture is loaded
classitems.name: onBaseTextureLoaded

classitems.description: Destroys this texture
classitems.name: destroy

params.name: destroyBase
params.description: Whether to destroy the base texture as well

classitems.description: Specifies the region of the baseTexture that this texture will use.
classitems.name: setFrame

params.name: frame
params.description: The frame of the texture to set it to

classitems.description: Updates the internal WebGL UV cache.
classitems.name: _updateUvs

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a Texture object from the given image url.
If the image is not in the texture cache it will be  created and loaded.
classitems.name: fromImage

params.name: imageUrl
params.description: The image url of the texture

params.name: crossorigin
params.description: Whether requests should be treated as crossorigin

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

classitems.description:
Helper function that returns a Texture objected based on the given frame id.
If the frame id is not in the texture cache an error will be thrown.
classitems.name: fromFrame

params.name: frameId
params.description: The frame id of the texture

classitems.description: Helper function that creates a new a Texture based on the given canvas element.
classitems.name: fromCanvas

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas element source of the texture

params.name: scaleMode
params.description: See {{#crossLink "PIXI/scaleModes:property"}}PIXI.scaleModes{{/crossLink}} for possible values

classitems.description: Adds a texture to the global PIXI.TextureCache. This cache is shared across the whole PIXI object.
classitems.name: addTextureToCache

params.name: texture
params.description: The Texture to add to the cache.

params.name: id
params.description: The id that the texture will be stored against.

classitems.description: Remove a texture from the global PIXI.TextureCache.
classitems.name: removeTextureFromCache

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the texture to be removed

classitems.description: Creates a new Canvas DOM element, or pulls one from the pool if free.
classitems.name: create

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the canvas element.

params.name: width
params.description: The width of the canvas element.

params.name: height
params.description: The height of the canvas element.

classitems.description: Gets the first free canvas index from the pool.
classitems.name: getFirst

classitems.description: Removes the parent from a canvas element from the pool, freeing it up for re-use.
classitems.name: remove

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the canvas element.

classitems.description: Removes the parent from a canvas element from the pool, freeing it up for re-use.
classitems.name: removeByCanvas

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas element to remove

classitems.description: Gets the total number of used canvas elements in the pool.
classitems.name: getTotal

return.description: The number of in-use (parented) canvas elements in the pool.

classitems.description: Gets the total number of free canvas elements in the pool.
classitems.name: getFree

return.description: The number of free (un-parented) canvas elements in the pool.

classitems.description: The pool into which the canvas dom elements are placed.
classitems.name: pool

classitems.description:
Originally based on https://github.com/mrdoob/eventtarget.js/ from mr Doob.
Currently takes inspiration from the nodejs EventEmitter, EventEmitter3, and smokesignals
Backward compat from when this used to be a function
Mixes in the properties of the EventTarget prototype onto another object
classitems.name: mixin

params.name: object
params.description: The obj to mix into

classitems.description: Return a list of assigned event listeners.
classitems.name: listeners

params.name: eventName
params.description: The events that should be listed.

classitems.description: Emit an event to all registered event listeners.
classitems.name: emit

params.name: eventName
params.description: The name of the event.

return.description: Indication if we've emitted an event.

classitems.description: Register a new EventListener for the given event.
classitems.name: on

params.name: eventName
params.description: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.description: fn Callback function.

classitems.description: Add an EventListener that's only called once.
classitems.name: once

params.name: eventName
params.description: Name of the event.

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback function.

classitems.description: Remove event listeners.
classitems.name: off

params.name: eventName
params.description: The event we want to remove.

params.name: callback
params.description: The listener that we need to find.

classitems.description: Remove all listeners or only the listeners for the specified event.
classitems.name: removeAllListeners

params.name: eventName
params.description: The event you want to remove all listeners for.

classitems.description:
Tracks the state of bubbling propagation. Do not
set this directly, instead use `event.stopPropagation()`
classitems.name: stopped

classitems.description:
Tracks the state of sibling listener propagation. Do not
set this directly, instead use `event.stopImmediatePropagation()`
classitems.name: stoppedImmediate

classitems.description: The original target the event triggered on.
classitems.name: target

classitems.description: The string name of the event that this represents.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: The data that was passed in with this event.
classitems.name: data

classitems.description: The timestamp when the event occurred.
classitems.name: timeStamp

classitems.description: Stops the propagation of events up the scene graph (prevents bubbling).
classitems.name: stopPropagation

classitems.description: Stops the propagation of events to sibling listeners (no longer calls any listeners).
classitems.name: stopImmediatePropagation

classitems.description: Triangulates shapes for webGL graphic fills.
classitems.name: Triangulate

classitems.description: Checks whether a point is within a triangle
classitems.name: _PointInTriangle

params.name: px
params.description: x coordinate of the point to test

params.name: py
params.description: y coordinate of the point to test

params.name: ax
params.description: x coordinate of the a point of the triangle

params.name: ay
params.description: y coordinate of the a point of the triangle

params.name: bx
params.description: x coordinate of the b point of the triangle

params.name: by
params.description: y coordinate of the b point of the triangle

params.name: cx
params.description: x coordinate of the c point of the triangle

params.name: cy
params.description: y coordinate of the c point of the triangle

classitems.description: Checks whether a shape is convex
classitems.name: _convex

classitems.description: Converts a hex color number to an [R, G, B] array
classitems.name: hex2rgb

classitems.description: Converts a color as an [R, G, B] array to a hex number
classitems.name: rgb2hex

classitems.description: Checks whether the Canvas BlendModes are supported by the current browser for drawImage
classitems.name: canUseNewCanvasBlendModes

classitems.description:
Given a number, this function returns the closest number that is a power of two
this function is taken from Starling Framework as its pretty neat ;)
classitems.name: getNextPowerOfTwo

return.description: the closest number that is a power of two

classitems.description: checks if the given width and height make a power of two texture
classitems.name: isPowerOfTwo

classitems.description: Version of pixi that is loaded.
classitems.name: VERSION

classitems.description:
The default render options if none are supplied to
{{#crossLink "WebGLRenderer"}}{{/crossLink}} or {{#crossLink "CanvasRenderer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: defaultRenderOptions

warnings.message:
Missing item type
Tests if a point is inside this graphics object

Missing item type
Creates a new GraphicsData object with the same values as this one.

Missing item type
If true Pixi will Math.floor() x/y values when rendering, stopping pixel interpolation.
Handy for crisp pixel art and speed on legacy devices.

Missing item type
TextureSilentFail is a boolean that defaults to `false`. 
If `true` then `PIXI.Texture.setFrame` will no longer throw an error if the texture dimensions are incorrect. 
Instead `Texture.valid` will be set to `false` (#1556)

Missing item type
Originally based on https://github.com/mrdoob/eventtarget.js/ from mr Doob.
Currently takes inspiration from the nodejs EventEmitter, EventEmitter3, and smokesignals

Missing item type
Backward compat from when this used to be a function
